text: [Music]
[Music]
hello I'm anushree A Cloud support
engineer here at the AWS office in
Portland today I'm going to show you how
we can redirect HTTP requests to https
using an application load balancer let's
get started after logging into the AWS
Management console navigate to the
Amazon elastic compute Cloud console
then on the navigation panel under load
balancing choose load balancers select
the appropriate load balancer and then
select listeners and then add listener
for protocol Port choose HTTP you can
either choose the default port or
specify a custom port for default action
choose redirect to for protocol enter
https and for Port choose 443 which is
the default port for https you can also
use a custom Port choose the check mark
and choose add listeners now the HTTP
request will start redirecting to https
our next action is to create an https
listener and forward the request to the
application let's again choose add
listener for protocol choose https for
Port select the port that you chose in
step 5 in the redirect action for
default action choose forward 2 and
select the appropriate Target group
choose the check mark for security
policy you can use the predefined policy
for https listener it's mandatory to use
certificates you have the option to
select a certificate from AWS
certificate manager which is recommended
from AWS identity and access management
or you can import the certificate
you can select the appropriate option
here and attach the certificate
choose add listeners
please note make sure to check the load
balancer security group so that it
allows traffic from Port 80 and Port 443
for successful communication with these
steps you can now redirect HTTP requests
to https using an application load
balancer thanks for watching and happy
cloud computing from all of us here at
AWS
[Music]
